verses.text: The LORD called to Moses and spoke to him from the tent of meeting, saying:
verses.comment: God initiates the laws from the tabernacle; 'tent of meeting' is a standard rendering.

verses.text: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, 'When any one of you brings an offering to the LORD, you shall bring your offering of livestock, either from the herd or from the flock.'
verses.comment: Clarifies 'when any man of you' as 'any one of you' to reflect the original audience inclusively, consistent with the Hebrew.

verses.text: If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall offer a male without blemish. He shall offer it at the entrance of the tent of meeting, so that he may be accepted before the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Burnt offering' translates 'olah'; 'male without blemish' preserves the sacrificial requirement.

verses.text: He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
verses.comment: 'To make atonement' is a direct rendering of the Hebrew 'lekapper'.

verses.text: Then he shall slaughter the bull before the LORD, and Aaron’s sons the priests shall bring the blood and throw the blood against the sides of the altar at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Kept 'slaughter' and 'throw'; some versions soften to 'kill' or 'sprinkle'.

verses.text: He shall flay the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.
verses.comment: 'Flay' is a direct translation of the Hebrew for 'skin'.

verses.text: Then the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar and arrange wood on the fire.
verses.comment: 'Arrange wood' translates literally from the Hebrew.

verses.text: And Aaron’s sons the priests shall arrange the pieces, the head, and the fat on the wood that is on the fire on the altar.
verses.comment: 'Arrange' echoes the Hebrew; kept 'head, and the fat' as explicit items.

verses.text: But its entrails and its legs he shall wash with water. And the priest shall offer all of it and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, a food offering with a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
verses.comment: 'A food offering' is 'ishsheh' in Hebrew, lit. 'offering by fire'.

verses.text: If his offering is a burnt offering from the flock, from the sheep or from the goats, he shall offer a male without blemish.
verses.comment: 'From the sheep or from the goats' follows the Hebrew closely.

verses.text: He shall slaughter it on the north side of the altar before the LORD, and Aaron’s sons the priests shall throw its blood against the sides of the altar.
verses.comment: 'North side' is a literal rendering—important for ritual precision.

verses.text: And he shall cut it into pieces, with its head and its fat, and the priest shall arrange them on the wood that is on the fire on the altar.
verses.comment: Closely parallels verse 8, as in the Hebrew.

verses.text: But the entrails and the legs he shall wash with water. And the priest shall offer all of it and burn it on the altar; it is a burnt offering, a food offering with a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
verses.comment: Repetition preserves Hebrew style; 'offer all of it' preserves the totality.

verses.text: If his offering to the LORD is a burnt offering of birds, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves or young pigeons.
verses.comment: 'Turtledoves or young pigeons'—preserves the distinction of possible birds.

verses.text: And the priest shall bring it to the altar, and wring off its head and burn it on the altar. Its blood shall be drained out on the side of the altar.
verses.comment: 'Wring off' is literal; some translations use 'pinch off'.

verses.text: He shall remove its crop with its contents and throw it beside the altar on the east side, in the place for the ashes.
verses.comment: 'Crop with its contents' captures the Hebrew 'with its feathers.'

verses.text: He shall tear it open by its wings without dividing it completely. And the priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, a food offering with a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Without dividing it completely' closely matches the Hebrew; ending phrase repeated as in Hebrew.
